meanings.definition: To cut or gather (a crop) for harvest.
meanings.sent1: The farmer was reaping the ripe wheat in the field.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys reaping the fruits of her labor after a successful harvest.
meanings.sent3: The scarecrow tried reaping the corn, but it kept falling apart.
meanings.sent4: He was reaping the benefits of his hard work, seeing the results pay off.
meanings.sent5: Reaping the golden corn under the warm sun was a satisfying task for the farmer.

meanings.definition: To receive as a consequence of one's own or others' actions.
meanings.sent1: By helping others, she was reaping kindness in return.
meanings.sent2: He is reaping the rewards of his good behavior.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat was reaping the consequences of its actions.
meanings.sent4: She found herself reaping the benefits of her positive attitude.
meanings.sent5: Reaping the praise from her boss made her feel appreciated and valued.

meanings.definition: To obtain or acquire as a result of effort.
meanings.sent1: After years of hard work, he was finally reaping the success he deserved.
meanings.sent2: She is reaping the benefits of her dedication to her studies.
meanings.sent3: The young entrepreneur was reaping the profits of his innovative idea.
meanings.sent4: By consistently practicing, she was reaping the rewards of her improved skills.
meanings.sent5: Reaping the knowledge from books helped him excel in his exams.
